data.title: Shameless and EastEnders star unrecognisable as he takes on new bad boy role in The Bay
data.meta_description: SHAMELESS fans have been left doing a double take after tuning in to the latest episode of The Bay.Viewers of the ITV drama were stunned to spot a sta
data.text:
SHAMELESS fans have been left doing a double take after tuning in to the latest episode of The Bay.

Viewers of the ITV drama were stunned to spot a star from the iconic noughties comedy playing an entirely different role.

Actor Chris Coghill was seen as a down-and-out drug addict, who turned up to speak to police following the murder of his sister Beth.

His bald character Alex Kirby couldn't look more different to that of Craig Garland from Shameless.

Alex also bears very little resemblance to Tony King, a much-hated role Chris played in EastEnders in 2008.

Soap fans will recall that Tony was Bianca's boyfriend - and also an evil paedophile who groomed and abused Whitney Dean over a three month period.

Chris' character Tony was eventually jailed for 13 years but later killed himself in his cell.

Taking to Twitter during Wednesday night's episode of The Bay, telly fans were quick to comment on Chris' new look.

One fan wrote: "I did not recognise Chris Coghill as a baldy banger. He does suit it though."

Another added: "Did Chris Coghill actually shave his head for this?"

And praising Chris' acting, a third chimed in: "In praise of Chris Coghill. Has that guy ever given a bad performance?"

Away from the cameras, Chris is highly private but is believed to be married to actress Rosalind Halstead.

He was previously married to actress and MasterChef champ Lisa Faulkner.

The couple tied the knot in 2005 but split six years later. They co-parent their adopted daughter Billie-May, who is now 17.
